title: Eriogonum breedlovei
text:
Eriogonum breedlovei is a rare species of <a href="Eriogonum">wild buckwheat</a> known by the common name Paiute buckwheat. It is <a href="Endemism">endemic</a> to the <a href="Sierra%20Nevada%20%28U.S.%29">High Sierra Nevada</a> of <a href="California">California</a>, where its two varieties are uncommon members of the flora in <a href="granite">granite</a> and <a href="limestone">limestone</a> rocky high mountain habitat.
Description.
"Eriogonum breedlovei" is a perennial herb forming low mats of spreading stems lined with woolly oval leaves no longer than about a centimeter. The <a href="inflorescence">inflorescence</a> is a cluster of tiny white to reddish, hairy flowers.
Varieties.
Both varieties of this species are rare:
